reviewText:
If you are a fan of sherlock holmes or detective games, this one is short but decent.  The production values are above average and the case isn't just spoon fed to you.

One thing:  It is SHORT.  Expect to have the entire game finished in 60-90 minutes.  Should you choose to pursue it, a perfect scoring run can be pieced together in 2-3 hours.  After that, there's absolutely no replay value to speak of.

Overall, a decent but short game.  Would not recommend full price given short run time, but at 99 cents or less it's probably worth picking up.

One final note:  While researching this game I came across a board of the same name that seemingly covers the exact same case.  If you've played that board game to completion I would pass on this game.

reviewText:
As a system, Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective is great. Follow the threads in a mystery, talk to experts and witnesses, piece together clues and figure out whodunnit. But this particular case is a mess, all because of one absurd contrivance at the end.

You can follow the evidence, establish motives, connect other events, eliminate suspects with deduction, etc. But when it's all said and done, the only person with the ability to participate in several key events never did. How's that possible? Well it's possible because the game straight up invents nonsense science that's neither supported by reality or by the evidence within the game. An intuitive leap to pull all the pieces together is fine, but it should be a leap to something that can actually happen.

The SHCD system is brilliant. I hope the other cases do it more justice.

reviewText: I have been a fan of all things Sherlock for many years and I decided to try this game on an impulse. The game is rather short and took just under two hours to finish. It was entertaining and thought-provoking and the video clips throughout are at times humorous. The cost of the game is reasonable although requires reading heaps of little bits of information, plus a little patience is also desirable. The interface is simple and easy to use and there are helpful and informative tutorials available.\n\nI would recommend this game for people who enjoy and love the stories of Sherlock Holmes and is interested in going on a small adventure with Holmes and Watson.
A good mystery that isn't guided at all - and it's a good thing. It's tough, and you probably won't get all the right answers the first time around, but it's fun nonetheless!
